commit.message: release 3.2.2+hh17 [an.sumin@hh.ru]

release 3.2.2+hh3 [d.smirnov@hh.ru]
Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/HH-51907' into EXP-14252
HH-51422 remove redundant cookies
HH-51422 add variable to export
HH-51422 fix error when two bad cookies in request
Backport guard against % signs
HH-51907 Always close curl socket
Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/HH-41232' into release-candidate
HH-46051 fix bug in SimpleCookie
HH-40589 fail-proof headers decoding

HH-35189 set header length cap to a more appropriate value

Conflicts:
	tornado/web.py
HH-28175 force curls to make fresh connections every time
patches for logging
move debian/* from 2.0 and improve .gitignore
Set version number to 3.2.2
Docs for xsrf cookie change; 3.2.2 release notes.

Add the option to request an older xsrf cookie version.

Fix an issue with v1 cookies on py32.

Change the xsrf cookie format to be masked with a random salt.

This protects against the BREACH attack.

Small security improvements to xsrf tokens; add tests.

Use os.urandom(16) instead of uuid.uuid4(), to reclaim a few bits of
entropy.  Use _time_independent_equals for comparison.
Fix imports for the new version of trollius, which changed its package name.
Update links to github repo; add announcement mailing list.
Give credit to Joost Pol for reporting the security issue.
Set version number to 3.2.1
v3.2.1 release notes
Document the cookie versioning interface.

Add a v2 secure cookie format.

This format fixes some weaknesses in the original format that would allow
characters to be shifted from the "value" field to the "name" or "timestamp"
fields.  It also upgrades the signature from HMAC-SHA1 to HMAC-SHA256,
adds an explicit version field, and adds an as-yet-unused field to
support key rotation in the future.
Add versioning parameters to secure_cookie/signed_value APIs.
Merge branch 'stable' into branch3.2

Add SystemError to errors from compilation

OSX generates a SystemError from a missing compiler; trap with other
compilation errors.

Merge pull request #1037 from toanant/patch-1

Update overview.rst with typos in nginx conf.

Update overview.rst with typos in nginx conf.

Minor correction in the production nginx server conf with proxy_redirect as off; previously it was false.
Don't require the extension to be present when building docs.

Reinstate the 'cd maint' in .travis.yml.

This turned out to be breaking the speedups module.
Add better debugging for ImportErrors resulting from TORNADO_EXTENSION=1

Add a new TORNADO_EXTENSION environment variable for testing purposes.

This variable can be set to 0 to suppress or 1 to require the use of the
extension (instead of the default to use it when it is available but silently
fall back).  Require the extension to be present on travis-ci.

Merge pull request #973 from cgohlke/patch-1

Fix msvc compile error and improve 64 bit compatibility
Fix msvc compile error and improve 64 bit compatibility
Update README.rst to match docs/index.rst.
Set version number to 3.2.
Finalize 3.2 release notes
Fix shell quoting in travis config.

Pin pycurl on travis to <7.19.3, removing it from py3.x.

SSL issues prevent pycurl 7.19.3 from being installed on travis.
Now that pycurl 7.19.3 with py3 support is out, add it to tox/travis.
Add a link to the Stack Overflow 'tornado' tag from the docs.
Replace redundant dict.get() with [].
Set version number to 3.2b2
Update release notes for 3.2.0b2

Add trollius (py2 backport of asyncio) to tox config.

This passes the twisted integration tests but currently has some issues
with pycurl.

Rename "normal" to "end_color" in log format strings.

When not colorizing, use empty strings instead of two copies of "normal".

Update docs.

Improved extensibility of LogFormatter

* refactored code separating coloring logic
* allow full line customization of the format
* possibly faster operation
Move _setup_logging to BaseIOLoop and use it in asyncio and twisted implementations.
Remove inaccurate IOLoop logging test cases.

Merge commit 'c2a25a'

* commit 'c2a25a':
  Correct example variable, use consistant quoting

Closes #972

Merge pull request #971 from gmr/logging-patch

Don't call logging.basicConfig if logging is already configured (#775). Replaces #887
Correct example variable, use consistant quoting

Don't call logging.basicConfig if logging is already configured (#775).
Will not call logging.basicConfig if there is a root logger,
tornado logger or tornado.application logger.

Updated patch to reflect comments about tests and method privacy.
Add a warning to the StaticFileHandler docs against overriding .get().
Remove redundant uses of @asynchronous with @gen.coroutine.

Doc updates.

* Version-added tags
* Add some missing methods
* Ignore asyncio module for coverage reports
* Work around a sphinx 1.2 regression

Update future imports for recently added files.

(This is most meaningful for tornado.platform.asyncio, which needs
absolute imports for the python 2 backport of asyncio).
Add usage comement to run_fixers.py.

Merge pull request #969 from ronnix/patch-1

Fix asyncio code example
Fix asyncio code example
Set version number to 3.2b1.
Add python 3.4 tag to setup.py
Reorganize and expand next-release notes.
Fix doc build on travis after removal of 'cd maint'

Remove 'cd maint' from travis script.

This was needed for 2to3, which we no longer use.  The changed
directory meant that coveralls wasn't seeing our .coveragerc.
Correctly skip coverage collection on 2.6.
Disable coverage collection on python 2.6.
Add coveralls to travis config.

Disable --pre flag in tox installs to fix environment recreation.

Remove an old hack for monotime package.
autopep8 whitespace fixes.
Update run_autopep8.sh flags.
Upgrade maint/requirements.txt versions.

Disallow ipv6 in curl-based tests.

The test servers only listen on ipv4, and it appears that libcurl 7.19.34
has regressed in its ability to handle the case when localhost resolves
to both v4 and v6 variants but only one works.

IPv6 was already disabled by default in simple_httpclient tests.

Use a more reliable method to generate resolver errors.

On some platforms even getaddrinfo is fooled by the fake NXDOMAIN results.
Fixes for soon-to-be-released py3-compatible version of pycurl.
Mark another timing-sensitive test as skipOnTravis.

Disable the "bad_host" tests on CaresResolver

This is an unfortunate hack, but c-ares doesn't handle fake NXDOMAIN
responses in the same way as other resolvers.

Merge pull request #965 from ajdavis/twisted-resolver-err

Error handling in TwistedResolver

Add some markup to the old template intro docs.

Closes #967.
Error handling in TwistedResolver

Improve log message for invalid unicode.

Truncate long values, and include the argument name if available.

Merge pull request #963 from minrk/invalid-unicode

bad unicode in URLs shouldn't cause 500
expect log message in test_decode_argument_invalid_unicode

Remove new HTTPRequest.if_modified_since property.

This property was unusual in that its getter returned a value its
setter would not accept, and was redundant with direct access to the
headers.

Use the property setters in the constructor instead of duplicating logic.
rase 400, not 500 on invalid unicode in decode_argument

Merge pull request #945 from chrismcguire/request_body_property

Add properties corresponding to HTTPRequest constructor arguments

Minor cleanups for import deadlock test:
* Avoid _test.py suffix for file that doesn't contain test cases.
* Resolve localhost instead of tornadoweb.org to avoid network dependency.
* Tighten timeout and add an alarm so failed tests don't leave orphaned
  child processes.
* Avoid busy loop while waiting for child to exit.

Merge pull request #964 from ajdavis/resolver-deadlock

Prevent a deadlock if ThreadedResolver resolves a unicode hostname at module-import time.
Prevent a deadlock if ThreadedResolver resolves a unicode hostname at module-import time.
test that invalid unicode doesn't raise 500
Un-force relative in format_date
Set altered HTTPRequest attributes as parameters.

Merge pull request #949 from Lardjo/patch-1

Added closing parenthesis

Update gen.py

Docs. Missing closing parenthesis on example.

Merge pull request #944 from anton-ryzhov/reset_flags

Reset state on `start()` end

Merge pull request #940 from klaussfreire/master

Speed up gen.corouting when yielding done Futures
Make setuptools optional again in setup.py.
Update docs for LogFormatter constructor arguments.

Merge pull request #931 from SuminAndrew/LogFormatter-format

add custom fmt and datefmt to LogFormatter

Avoid a quote mark that renders incorrectly in PDF mode.

Closes #935.

Document the attributes required by @run_on_executor.

Closes #933.

Merge pull request #936 from ticosax/add-timeout-on-future

Pass timeout argument to Future.result

Merge pull request #937 from lepture/fix-assert

Raise TypeError instead of AssertionError.
Reset state on `start()` end
Speed up gen.corouting when yielding done Futures
Raise TypeError instead of AssertionError.
Pass timeout argument to Future.result
add custom fmt and datefmt to LogFormatter
Document the HTTPResponse.effective_url attribute.
Update next-release notes and document the asyncio module.
Clean up some uncollectable garbage in the test suite.

Document the fact that WebSocketClientConnection should not be used directly.

Closes #929.

Catch exceptions from parse_qs_bytes in POST bodies and log them.

This is consistent with error handling for multipart/form-data.
parse_qs is very liberal, but the conversion to unicode
on python 3 may fail.  This is most common for binary data sent from
clients where x-www-form-urlencoded is the default, which is not
actually intended to be interpreted as arguments.

Closes #921.
Fix speedups.c when compiled with gcc instead of clang.
Point Ubuntu 12.04 Vagrant file to a readily-available base image.
Make the C extension optional.

Replace cython-based extension module with a hand-written one.

This avoids the complexity of ensuring that cython is installed
at build time.

Add backports.ssl_match_hostname dependency in place of our copy.

This function has changed recently and it makes more sense to stop
maintaining a separate copy, even though it does introduce our first
required dependency.

Merge pull request #928 from ajdavis/better-assertion-in-httpclient

Better AsyncHTTPClient error for GET with body or POST without one. Fixes #927.

simple_httpclient: Start the connection timeout before the Resolver call.

Timeouts were previously unenforced during DNS resolution.
Better AsyncHTTPClient error for GET with body or POST without one.

Merge pull request #926 from liangsun/master

Add `name` parameter for URLSpec in tuple/list format.
Add name parameter for URLSpec in tuple/list format.
Update next-release notes.
Fix --debug_gc option on python 3.

Don't make the request if it timed out in the queue.

Use IOLoop time instead of request.start_time (which is wall time).
Misc test fixes.
Merge remote-tracking branch 'codeb2cc/async-request-timeout' into merge
Rearrange newly-added optional arguments for backwards compatibility.

Merge remote-tracking branch 'sclm/GoogleOAuth2' into merge

Conflicts:
	docs/releases/next.rst
Add test for the websocket connection-refused fix.

Merge pull request #910 from Caligatio/patch-1

Fixed WebSocketClient connections not closing on initial connection failure

Change hard-coded SSL protocol version for Python 2.6 to TLSv1.

The compatibility advantage of SSLv3 was always small, and it's probably
better to use TLSv1 than SSLv3 now.

Closes #911.

Fix some cases where curl_httpclient options could leak to subsequent requests.

Document the remaining cases which cannot cleanly be set back to their default
values.

Uncovered by #912.
Add generated speedups.c to .gitignore.
Add test for specifying handlers by name.

Merge pull request #925 from mengzhuo/master

unify web.handlers
unify web.handlers

Remvoe auto2to3 exclusion rules.

auto2to3 is no longer a part of the Tornado development process,
and the MANIFEST exclusion rule just results in scary-looking warnings
when installing.
Add more tests for the cython websocket mask function

Add cython-based speedup for websocket mask function.

This optimization is currently activated only if Cython is present
when Tornado is installed.

Add a tox config for the py33 backport of asyncio.

Update some old comments.

Split AsyncIOLoop to make it possible to use the global asyncio event loop.

AsyncIOLoop works more like Tornado's native IOLoop so it's better for
our tests, but AsyncIOMainLoop is more appropriate for most real-world
usage.

Initial version of asyncio/tulip-based IOLoop.

Currently always creates a new asyncio event loop instead of using
an existing one.

Add close method to websocket client; fix socket leaks in websocket_test.

These leaks are detected only in python 3.4 thanks to its improved
generator GC.

Disable test_subprocess on LayeredTwistedIOLoop.

This test fails occasionally in this configuration (but strangely, the
other subprocess tests work).  I haven't been able to track it down
so just disable it for now to prevent spurious travis-ci errors.

Check for the existence of sys.stderr.isatty before calling it.

Only the `write` method is guaranteed to exist on sys.stderr and sys.stdout.

Closes #920.
Return the correct type when yielding an empty dict.

Merge pull request #915 from anton-ryzhov/yield_dict

Yielding dicts from coroutine
Documentation for yielding dicts
Yielding dict in coroutine

Merge pull request #913 from tahajahangir/patch-1

Don't raise connection reset errors in `set_nodelay`

Fix double logging of exceptions with both @asynchronous and @coroutine.

Tornado 3.1 made the @asynchronous decorator optional when @coroutine
is used, but if it was used anyway both @asynchronous and the new code
would log any uncaught exceptions.

Don't raise connection reset errors in `set_nodelay`

If connection was reset, `request.finish()` wrongly raises socket.error instead of ignoring the error.
Fixed WebSocketClient connections not closing on initial connection failure

Polish for extra debug-mode settings.

Split template_cache into two settings, for template and static files.
Rename several options.  Update docs.

Merge pull request #896 from jniznan/master

Possibility to disable autoreload when debug is on
Expand argument-origin tests to include the plural methods.
Undo erronous chmod +x's

Merge pull request #907 from MrTravisB/master

Support distinguishing argument origin between query and body.
ise items() since iteritems() not in py3
Fix wsgi

- Plural query/body arg methods.
- Updated Tests.
- Don't change signature of public methods.
Support argument origin
possibility to disable autoreload when debug is on

Fix unix socket error test on python 3 on linux.

The remote address of a unix socket is apparently an empty character
string on mac but an empty byte string on linux.

Don't assume IP-style socket addresses in error messages.

Closes #900.

Fix warnings during final GC of the test suite in python 3.4a1.

3.4 can GC things that were uncollectable before, like abandoned generators.
It also seems generates ResourceWarnings for unclosed files in places
where older versions did not.

Add a default_handler_class setting for custom 404 pages.

The previous solution for custom 404s (a r'.*' rule at the end of the
handlers list) proved to be undiscoverable for many users, and it
could be nontrivial to put the rule in the right place in the presence
of multiple add_handlers calls and the implicit StaticFileHandler rules.

Set Connection: keep-alive header directly without going through set_header.

set_header is not allowed in WebSocketHandler, but some proxies add
this header unconditionally.

Closes #897.

Allow preconstructed HTTPRequest objects in websocket_connect.

In particular this allows for headers to be passed in to simulate
browser authentication behavior.
Clean up GoogleOAuth2Mixin, fold scope and response_type into the base OAuth2Mixin
Remove `async_timeout` and use `connect_timeout` instead

Merge branch 'branch3.1'

Conflicts:
	docs/releases.rst
	setup.py
	tornado/__init__.py
Set version number to 3.1.1
Add 3.1.1 release notes.

RequestHandler sets its close callback on the HTTPConnection, not the IOStream.

Fixes a bug in which close callbacks would never be called for subsequent
requests on a reused connection.
Fix exception in StaticFileHandler when range requested is larger than file.
Stop making an absolute URL for GoogleOAuth2Mixin
Rename the object param in GoogleOAuth2Mixin from overwrites to extra_params.
Bump verison number to 3.2.dev2

Check for empty strings and zero bytes in is_valid_ip.

Closes #893.

Merge pull request #889 from pabelanger/temp/license

Add top level LICENSE file

Add top level LICENSE file

Simlpe commit to add the Apache License, Version 2.0 to the top level
directory.

Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <paul.belanger@polybeacon.com>
Add a test case for async_timeout in SimpleAsyncHTTPClient.

Add timeout for requests in SimpleAsyncHTTPClient's queue.

The connect_timeout and request_timeout in HTTPRequest only matter when
the _HTTPConnection get created. In heavy-loadded situation requests in
SimpleAsyncHTTPClient may have already timeouted before they pop out
from queue and get actual processed. This commit adds an timeout
callback for every request appended to SimpleAsyncHTTPClient's request
queue that cannot be processed immediately.

In add_callback, hold the lock while writing to the waker pipe.

This protects against a shutdown race condition seen occasionally in
the ThreadedResolver unittests.  This slightly increases contention
on the callback lock in multi-threaded scenarios, but the cost is
limited by the fact that we only write to the pipe once per IOLoop
iteration.

Closes #875.

Add a distinct exception for writing a WebSocket message on a closed connection.

This replaces an AttributeError on NoneType.

Closes #879.

Document the fact that the {% module %} directive requires a RequestHandler.

Closes #880.
Emphasize and clarify docs for AsyncHTTPClient.close.

Document Windows support (or lack thereof).

Closes #871.
Update next-release notes.
Add comments for domain and path arguments to cookie-clearing methods.

Merge pull request #874 from skazhy/clear-all-cookies-custom-domain

Allow deleting all cookies on custom domains

Update ca-certificates.crt to the current Mozilla version.

This file was generated by downloading
https://mxr.mozilla.org/mozilla/source/security/nss/lib/ckfw/builtins/certdata.txt?raw=1
in a web browser to avoid the chicken-and-egg problem with mk-ca-bundle's
built-in downloading, and then running "mk-ca-bundle.pl -n".

Note that we were not affected by the recently-fixed curl bug
(https://github.com/bagder/curl/commit/51f0b798fa), but only because
it had been so long since we had updated this file.
Allow deleting all cookies on custom domains
Less crude fix for #855: only do anything for already-connected sockets.
Merge remote-tracking branch 'pitrou/issue855-ssl-auto-handshake'

RequestHandler sets its close callback on the HTTPConnection, not the IOStream.

Fixes a bug in which close callbacks would never be called for subsequent
requests on a reused connection.

Clear the IOStream buffers on close even when there is no close callback.

Closes #828. (again)
Route all callback error logging in IOLoop through handle_callback_exception.

Merge pull request #859 from schlamar/patch-1

Make poll timeout patchable.
Make poll timeout patchable.
Fix up documentation for the class and the Sphinx reference.
Add in Google OAuth2 support.

Crude fix for issue #855: automatically initiate SSL handshake in SSLIOStream.
Perhaps this should be exposed as an option instead?

Merge pull request #851 from taguchimail/master

Correctly handle EAGAIN when writing to PipeIOStreams

Merge pull request #848 from SuprDewd/issue_820

Fixed laziness of current_user in UI modules, and added tests for current_user.

Correctly handle EAGAIN when writing to PipeIOStreams

BaseIOStream._handle_write needs to catch IOError and OSError as
well as socket.error in order to handle EAGAIN when writing to a
PipeIOStream (which doesn't appear to raise socket.error when the
buffer is full).

This also provides consistency with the exceptions caught by
BaseIOStream._read_to_buffer.
Fix exception in StaticFileHandler when range requested is larger than file.
Fixed laziness of current_user in UI modules, and added tests for current_user. #820

Clear the write buffer when an IOStream is closed.

Closes #828.

Unify lists of errnos used in IOStream.

We generally want to treat aborted connections the same regardless of the
specific errno, but some calls caught ECONNRESET and ECONNABORTED
while others only caught ECONNRESET.  Reported in #828.
Start next release notes

Clear the loop variable in addition to the callback list.

Closes #844.

Update FacebookGraphMixin with new authorization url.

The old url still works, but results in an extra redirect.
Use TracebackFuture for all internal Futures for better tracebacks on py2.x.

Clear local variables in IOLoop to allow GC before we start polling.

Closes #836.

Close pipe file descriptors if subprocess.Popen fails.

Closes #834.

Add apostrophes to xhtml_escape.

Closes #833.
Update twisted test blacklist for the newly-released 13.1.0.

Merge pull request #831 from erkyrath/master

Fixed incorrect error message in _when_complete (#829)

Fix run_with_stack_context test.

This test would never fail because it didn't check the result of its
Future.  Thanks to Florian Ludwig for pointing this out.
Fix issue 829 -- error message is displaying wrong incorrect result.

Merge pull request #824 from GrahamDumpleton/master

WSGI specification requires that close() be called on iterable no matter what happens.
Set master branch version to 3.2.dev1
WSGI specification requires that close() be called on iterable no matter what happens.
Set version to 3.1.
Move next release notes to v3.1.
Release note updates.
Remove obsolete comment about twitter's support for callback urls.
Add another small encoding test for xhtml_escape.

Fix default IOLoop in Subprocess.

Exit callbacks would fail for Subprocesses that did not explicitly
set an IOLoop.

Set CLOEXEC on subprocess pipe endpoints so they are not inherited by the child.

This is what the subprocess module does when it creates pipes, and is
necessary so that a close of the writing side of the stdin pipe will
be recognized by the child process.

Merge pull request #823 from schlamar/bind-sockets-ipv6

Fix bind_sockets if OS does not support IPv6
Doc updates from Zhigang Wang
Fix bind_sockets if OS does not support IPv6

Merge pull request #819 from dominiqueplante/master

update comparison check to follow PEP8
update comparison to follow pep8
Document websocket error handling change (and StreamClosedError).

Catch StreamClosedErrors in WebSocketHandler and abort.

When the stream is closed with buffered data, the close callback won't
be run until all buffered data is consumed, but any attempt to write
to the stream will fail, as will reading past the end of the buffer.
This requires a try/except around each read or write, analogous to the
one introduced in HTTPServer in commit 3258726f.

Closes #604.
Closes #661.
Set version number to 3.1b1
Release note updates
gen.coroutine works with auth now so we can use it in the docs.

Merge branch 'branch3.0'

Conflicts:
	docs/releases.rst
	setup.py
	tornado/__init__.py
	tornado/auth.py
Version bump and release notes for 3.0.2.

Update twitter base urls to use api 1.1 and HTTPS.

This is in preparation for the shutdown of version 1 of the API on
June 11.

Closes #809.
Copy .gitignore update from master to branch3.0

Restore a recently-removed ExpectLog in simple_httpclient_test.

Some IOLoops still log warnings when a connection is refused.

Reuse a single ThreadPoolExecutor for all ThreadedResolvers.

The primary motivation is that shutting down a ThreadPoolExecutor takes
100ms in the 2.x backported version of concurrent.futures.  It's also
generally unnecessary to create lots of DNS resolver threads just
because multiple resolver objects are used.

Document ExecutorResolver for public use.
Fix tests broken by move to verify_credentials

Get the current user's twitter information with /account/verify_credentials.

This is more robust against potentially-changing screen names.

Closes #51.

Update twitter base urls to use api 1.1 and HTTPS.

This is in preparation for the shutdown of version 1 of the API on
June 11.

Closes #809.

issue_comments.body:
Круто, наглядно

Пара патчей может исчезнуть после перехода на 4.3
Куки мы пытались впихнуть в апстрим (в конце концов у Джанги и Фласка такие патчи есть), но не зашло
Ещё для xsrf вроде был багфикс, его пока даже не засылали в апстрим
С логированием тоже можно попробовать в апстрим пойти, оно в торнаде не очень гибкое
@SuminAndrew сделай, пожалуйста, новый аналогичный PR. Этот закрою.

review_comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -49,38 +44,7 @@
     from urllib.parse import urlencode  # py3
 
 
-_tc = Cookie.SimpleCookie()
-try:
-    _tc.load(str('foo:bar=1'))
-    _cookie_allows_colon_in_names = True
-except Cookie.CookieError:
-    _cookie_allows_colon_in_names = False
-
-if _cookie_allows_colon_in_names:
-    SimpleCookie = Cookie.SimpleCookie
-else:
-    class SimpleCookie(Cookie.SimpleCookie):
-        """A dictionary of Cookie.Morsel objects.
-
-        Due the bug in Cookie module (http://bugs.python.org/issue2193) colon in cookie's name
-        will throw an exception in Python < 3.3. We do not want to miss all the cookies when one of them is invalid.
-        """
-        def load(self, rawdata):
-            self.bad_cookies = []
-            self._BaseCookie__set = self._loose_set
-            Cookie.SimpleCookie.load(self, rawdata)
-            self._BaseCookie__set = self._strict_set
-            for key in self.bad_cookies:

+from tornado.test.util import unittest
+
+from tornado.cookie import PatchedSimpleCookie
+
+
+class PatchedCookieTest(unittest.TestCase):
+
+    def test_correct_cookie(self):
+        cookie_parser = PatchedSimpleCookie()
+
+        raw_cookie = 'hhuid=DrlybFQqzbbRklTLRSY27A--; ' \
+                     'regions=1; ' \
+                     '__gfp_64b=2_Zs.24hSBFvVDWb.brHgjdmpsTCVKFjy2M_zyBcBiX.Q7; ' \
+                     '_xsrf=4c983fe0c9f384e18e610be0fedb468b; ' \
+                     '_xsrf=4c983fe0c9f384e18e610be0fedb468b; ' \
+                     'hhrole=anonymous; ' \
+                     'GMT=3; ' \
+                     '_ym_visorc_156828=b; ' \
+                     '_ym_visorc_26843553=w; ' \
+                     '__utma=1.670099261.1429860149.1429860149.1429860149.1; ' \
+                     '__utmb=1.6.10.1429860149; ' \
+                     '__utmc=1; ' \
+                     '__utmz=1.1429860149.1.1.utmcsr=(direct)|utmccn=(direct)|utmcmd=(none)'
+
+        cookie_parser.load(raw_cookie)
+
+        self.assertEqual(cookie_parser.get('hhuid').value, 'DrlybFQqzbbRklTLRSY27A--')
+        self.assertEqual(cookie_parser.get('regions').value, '1')
+        self.assertEqual(cookie_parser.get('__gfp_64b').value, '2_Zs.24hSBFvVDWb.brHgjdmpsTCVKFjy2M_zyBcBiX.Q7')
+        self.assertEqual(cookie_parser.get('_xsrf').value, '4c983fe0c9f384e18e610be0fedb468b')
+        self.assertEqual(cookie_parser.get('hhrole').value, 'anonymous')
+        self.assertEqual(cookie_parser.get('GMT').value, '3')
+        self.assertEqual(cookie_parser.get('_ym_visorc_156828').value, 'b')
+        self.assertEqual(cookie_parser.get('_ym_visorc_26843553').value, 'w')
+        self.assertEqual(cookie_parser.get('__utma').value, '1.670099261.1429860149.1429860149.1429860149.1')
+        self.assertEqual(cookie_parser.get('__utmb').value, '1.6.10.1429860149')
+        self.assertEqual(cookie_parser.get('__utmc').value, '1')
+        self.assertEqual(cookie_parser.get('__utmz').value, '1.1429860149.1.1.utmcsr=(direct)|utmccn=(direct)|utmcmd=(none)')
+
+    def test_wrong_cookie(self):
